content:
There are several materials commonly used to make biodegradable packaging, including: 

1. Plant-based plastics such as polylactic acid (PLA) and polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA).
2. Paper and cardboard products, such as paper bags, egg cartons, and cereal boxes.
3. Mushroom-based materials, such as mycelium and fungal mycelium composites.
4. Edible materials, such as starch-based films and coatings made from chitosan.
5. Biodegradable plastics made from corn starch, potato starch, or other natural resources.
